column4: ok so are there any boards that ubuntu has trouble being compatable with the sound-card drivers?
was trying to research it, but haven't found anything yet
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HardwareSupport
look it up on the maker's website
type alsamixer in the terminal and make sure all the sliders are up and not muted
welcome to 1980
little thingy at the bottom of the slider,   toggle it on and off with the M key
I beleive mm is muted, let me check
mm is muted 00 is with sound
just unmute everything
just keep clcking the right arrow, there are a lot more sliders then the half dozen on the one screen
yes
in the menu > system > prefs > sound ,  make sure you have the corect output device selected
try them all if you need to
I have all mine set to automatic detection
I tried ubuntu as an intro to linux in 2006 because It thought it might help with jobs,  took me 5 days to reboot windows and that was just to get my email infor
in the terminal type  gnome-control-center ,  click the sound thingy in there , set all the audio devices to automatic
don't need rebootmuch in linux
have you tried this ?
best of luck
goto menu > systsem> admin > user. check your users properties make sure you have permissionto use sound device
give it to root , just in case
